name: Ext.data.amf.Encoder
doc:
This class serializes data in the Action Message Format (AMF) format. It can write simple and complex objects, to be used in conjunction with an AMF-compliant server. To encode a byte array, first construct an Encoder, optionally setting the format:

var encoder = Ext.create('Ext.data.amf.Encoder', {
  format: 3
});

Then use the writer methods to out data to the :

encoder.writeObject(1);

And access the data through the bytes property: encoder.bytes;

You can also reset the class to start a new byte array:

encoder.clear();

Current limitations: AMF3 format (format:3) - writeObject will write out XML object, not legacy XMLDocument objects. A writeXmlDocument method is provided for explicitly writing XMLDocument objects. - Each object is written out explicitly, not using the reference tables supported by the AMF format. This means the function does NOT support circular reference objects. - Array objects: only the numbered indices and data will be written out. Associative values will be ignored. - Objects that aren't Arrays, Dates, Strings, Document (XML) or primitive values will be written out as anonymous objects with dynamic data. - There's no JavaScript equivalent to the ByteArray type in ActionScript, hence data will never be searialized as ByteArrays by the writeObject function. A writeByteArray method is provided for writing out ByteArray objects.

AMF0 format (format:0) - Each object is written out explicitly, not using the reference tables supported by the AMF format. This means the function does NOT support circular reference objects. - Array objects: the function always writes an associative array (following the behavior of flex). - Objects that aren't Arrays, Dates, Strings, Document (XML) or primitive values will be written out as anonymous objects.

For more information on working with AMF data please refer to the AMF Guide.

members.name: clear
members.doc: Reset all class states and starts a new empty array for encoding data. The method generates a new array for encoding, so it's safe to keep a reference to the old one.
members.short_doc: Reset all class states and starts a new empty array for encoding data. ...

members.doc: Converts an XML Document object to a string.
members.short_doc: Converts an XML Document object to a string. ...

members.doc: Encodes a U29 int, returning a byte array with the encoded number.
members.short_doc: Encodes a U29 int, returning a byte array with the encoded number. ...

members.doc: Writes an associative array in AMF0 format.
members.short_doc: Writes an associative array in AMF0 format. ...

members.doc: Writes the appropriate AMF0 boolean value to the byte array.

members.doc: Writes a date in AMF0 format.
members.short_doc: Writes a date in AMF0 format. ...

members.name: write0GenericObject
members.doc: Write an object to the byte array in AMF0 format. Since we don't have the class information form Flex, the object is written as an anonymous object.
members.short_doc: Write an object to the byte array in AMF0 format. ...

members.doc: Writes the AMF0 null value to the byte array.
members.short_doc: Writes the AMF0 null value to the byte array. ...

members.doc: Writes a numberic value to the byte array in AMF0 format

params.name: item
params.doc: A native numeric value, Number instance or one of Infinity, -Infinity or NaN

members.doc: Writes a key-value pair in AMF0 format.

members.name: write0ShortUtf8String
members.doc: Writes a short UTF8 string preceded with a 16-bit length.
members.short_doc: Writes a short UTF8 string preceded with a 16-bit length. ...

members.name: write0StrictArray
members.doc: Writes a strict-array in AMF0 format. Unordered parts are ignored (e.g. a["hello"] will not be encoded). This function is included for completeness and will never be called by writeObject.
members.short_doc: Writes a strict-array in AMF0 format. ...

members.name: write0String
members.doc: Write an AMF0 UTF-8 string to the byte array
members.short_doc: Write an AMF0 UTF-8 string to the byte array ...

members.name: write0Undefined
members.doc: Writes the AMF0 undefined value to the byte array.
members.short_doc: Writes the AMF0 undefined value to the byte array. ...

members.name: write0Xml
members.doc: Writes an XMLDocument in AMF0 format.
members.short_doc: Writes an XMLDocument in AMF0 format. ...

members.name: write3Array
members.doc: Writes an array in AMF3 format. Only the ordered part of the array use handled. Unordered parts are ignored (e.g. a["hello"] will not be encoded).
members.short_doc: Writes an array in AMF3 format. ...

members.name: write3Boolean
members.doc: Writes the appropriate AMF3 boolean value to the byte array.
members.short_doc: Writes the appropriate AMF3 boolean value to the byte array. ...

members.name: write3ByteArray
members.doc: Write a byte array in AMF3 format. This function is never called directly by writeObject since there's no way to distinguish a regular array from a byte array.
members.short_doc: Write a byte array in AMF3 format. ...

members.name: write3Date
members.doc: Writes a date in AMF3 format.
members.short_doc: Writes a date in AMF3 format. ...

members.doc: Write an object to the byte array in AMF3 format. Since we don't have the class information form Flex, the object is written as an anonymous object.

members.name: write3XmlDocument
members.doc: Writes an Legacy XMLDocument (ActionScript Legacy XML object) in AMF3 format. Must be called explicitly. The writeObject method will call writeXml and not writeXmlDocument.
members.short_doc:
Writes an Legacy XMLDocument (ActionScript Legacy XML object) in AMF3
format. ...

members.name: write3XmlWithType
members.doc: Writes an XML document in AMF3 format.

params.name: amfType
params.doc: Either 0x07 or 0x0B - the AMF3 object type to use

members.short_doc: Writes an XML document in AMF3 format. ...

members.name: writeAmfHeader
members.doc: Write an AMF header to the byte array. AMF headers are always encoded in AMF0.

params.name: mustUnderstand
params.doc: true if the receiver must understand this header or else reject it, false otherwise

params.name: value
params.doc: the value to serialize. Must be an object that can be serialized by AMF

members.short_doc: Write an AMF header to the byte array. ...

members.name: writeAmfMessage
members.doc: Writes an AMF message to the byte array. AMF messages are always encoded in AMF0.

params.name: body
params.doc: the parameters to pass to the called method, wrapped in an array

members.short_doc: Writes an AMF message to the byte array. ...

members.name: writeAmfPacket
members.doc: Writes an AMF packet to the byte array

params.name: headers
params.doc: the headers to serialize. Each item in the array should be an object with three fields: name, mustUnderstand, value

params.name: messages
params.doc: the messages to serialize. Each item in the array should be an object with three fields: targetUri, responseUri, body

members.short_doc: Writes an AMF packet to the byte array ...

members.name: writeByte
members.doc: Writes a byte to the byte array
members.short_doc: Writes a byte to the byte array ...

members.name: writeBytes
members.doc: Writes a byte array to the byte array

params.name: b
params.doc: Byte array to append to the array

members.short_doc: Writes a byte array to the byte array ...

members.name: writeObject
members.doc: Write the appropriate data items to the byte array. Supported types: - undefined - null - boolean - integer (if AMF3 - limited by 29-bit int, otherwise passed as double) - double - UTF-8 string - XML Document (identified by being instaneof Document. Can be generated with: new DOMParser()).parseFromString(xml, "text/xml");

params.name: item
params.doc: A primitive or object to write to the stream

members.short_doc: Write the appropriate data items to the byte array. ...

short_doc: This class serializes data in the Action Message Format (AMF) format. ...
